p: We sought next to determine whether novel isoforms were RSV-inducible. For this purpose, quantitative real-time PCR (qRT-PCR) Sybr Green assays were developed. For each isoform, we determined the fold change of RSV-infected cells vs. mock treatment ( Figure 10C). Of the isoforms assayed, we noted that PB6969.13 (containing intron 1) is the most highly inducible by RSV infection, showing a 13-fold induction ( p < 0.01, t-tailed t-test). Note that all isoforms are induced by RSV infection, consistent with their earlier definitions as DIU isoforms.
